intro: Quercus pachyloma var. mubianensis, commonly known as the Mubian oak, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its small, acorn-like fruits and dense, broad leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
